intro: Humiria contracta, commonly known as the narrowleaf humiria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Humiria contracta is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks.
